Description: ASTRA: The Russian Aerospace Forces again dropped an aerial bomb on the Belgorod region. According to ASTRA sources in the emergency services of the Belgorod region, on October 10, a FAB-500 was found in the Shebekinsky urban district, a few kilometers from the village of Neklyudovo. Injured and damaged... FAB-500 was found near a cafe in the occupied village of Korsun, Donetsk region According to ASTRA, an unexploded FAB-500 was found near a cafe in the village of Korsun in the Yenakievo City Council. There were no casualties or damage.According to ASTRA estimates, this is at least the 129th air bomb that fell as a result of an emergency landing on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine from March to October this year.As before ASTRA reported that in order to counter Ukrainian air defenses, the Russian army began equipping Soviet FAB aerial bombs with UMPC complexes. After this update, FABs now have wings and satellite guidance, allowing them to launch bombs directly from Russian territory. Previously confirmation of the use of the winged FAB-3000 in Ukraine was published. The numbers in the name of such bombs indicate the total weight of the product.The Russian army began actively using the UMPC in the spring of this year. And the problem of the updated FABs immediately emerged - often the bombs simply do not reach Ukraine. According to ASTRA estimates, in total, from March to September, Russian planes dropped at least 129 aerial bombs on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine. FAB-250 and FAB-500 fall most often. Usually, in case of emergency, they do not explode - the bombs are destroyed after the fact by explosives technicians. At the beginning of July, FAB-3000 fell for the first time from a Russian plane in the Belgorod region. A bomb exploded in a field near Shebekino. Since the bomb fell in a field, there were no casualties. May 4 a Russian plane dropped a FAB-500 on Belgorod, as a result of which 7 people were injured, 31 households and 10 cars damaged. Title: üé¨ Near Tuapse, workers threw bags of oil-contaminated pebbles on...
Description: Near Tuapse, workers threw bags of oil-contaminated pebbles on the beach. Some of them have already been carried away into the Black SeaOn October 8, a high alert regime was introduced in the Tuapse region in the Krasnodar Territory due to the appearance of an oil slick. Its size was not reported, but on the shore the area affected by the oil spill was approximately 700 square meters. -More than 400 bags of garbage containing contaminated sand and pebbles have already been collected. 43 people and 13 pieces of equipment are cleaning the shore,- the press service of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Krasnodar Territory reported the next day.Judging by the videos published on social networks on October 14, since then bags with contaminated The pebbles were never removed from the coastline, ASTRA noted. Local publicists claim that some of the bags have already been carried out to sea by the storm. To confirm this evidence, the video showed empty bags of pebbles washed ashore. The authorities did not report the reasons for the oil spill in the Black Sea. The day before the introduction of a high alert regime in the Tuapse area - at night on October 7 - Ukrainian Armed Forces The Marine Oil Terminal in Feodosia was attacked. This is the largest terminal in Crimea in terms of oil products transshipment volume. According to ASTRA sources, after the attack on this terminal a fuel spill occurred, which subsequently caught fire. After the attack, a fire at this oil depot could not extinguish the fire for another five days.It is noteworthy that a week and a half before the attack on the terminal in Feodosia and the appearance of a fuel spill near Tuapse, fire drills were held in the waters of these two ports oil spill response. -Training objectives have been achieved, the exercise plan has been fully implemented-, - reported then the Marine Rescue Service. Description: -They are slowly killing Maria,- the family of Belarusian political prisoner Maria Kolesnikova has not received letters from her for a year and a half No one has seen Belarusian oppositionist Maria Kolesnikova for 18 months. Her family does not know what is wrong with the woman now, since all this time they have not received letters from her. They told a journalist about this after leaving the colony. In November 2022, Kolesnikova was transferred to the intensive care unit for surgery to remove an ulcer‚Äîthe AP does not specify whether Kolesnikova pleaded for medical help before or after that. Kolesnikova was a prominent figure in the Belarusian opposition amid the presidential elections and subsequent mass protests in 2020. Then Kolesnikova was the head of headquarters of one of the candidates, Viktor Babariko, and then joined the joint headquarters of Svetlana Tikhanovskaya and the Coordination Council for organizing the process of overcoming the political crisis. For participation in the activities of the coordination council, Kolesnikova was sentenced to 11 years in prison under the article on creating an extremist group. Title: üñº A former Crimean riot policeman from Berkut and a participant ...
Description: A former Crimean riot policeman from Berkut and a participant in the war with Ukraine became vice-governor of the Samara region. Just two months ago, he received a similar post in another region41-year-old Maxim Kovalev was appointed vice-governor of the Samara region - he headed the department for law and order and anti-corruption, reported the regional governor Vyacheslav Fedorishchev. Apparently, the appointment of Kovalev as vice-governor is part of the trend to promote war participants in Ukraine to government positions. Kovalev is a native of Sevastopol, who before the annexation of Crimea served in the special forces unit of the Ukrainian police -Berkut-. After the annexation, Berkut came under the command of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs (and then the Russian National Guard), and Kovalev eventually received the post of commander of the Sevastopol Berkut-S. The soldiers of this riot police unit participated in the war in Ukraine from the very beginning, mark -Important stories.- In August 2024, Kovalev took the post of vice-governor in another region - in the Vologda region. There he was responsible for public safety and law enforcement issues. According to local media, the former riot policeman resigned from this post in September. What caused the dismissal (and whether it was completely voluntary) is unknown. In Ukraine, a criminal case has been opened against Kovalev under articles of encroachment on the territorial integrity of Ukraine, treason, and misappropriation of firearms.

Description: ASTRA: The Russian Aerospace Forces again dropped an aerial bomb on the Belgorod region According to ASTRA sources in the emergency services of the Belgorod region, on October 10 in the Shebekinsky urban district, in FAB-500 was found several kilometers from the village of Neklyudovo. There were no casualties or damage.According to ASTRA estimates, this is at least the 128th air bomb that fell on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine from March to October this year.As before told ASTRA, to counter Ukrainian air defense, the Russian army began to equip Soviet FAB aerial bombs with UMPC complexes. After this update, FABs now have wings and satellite guidance, allowing them to launch bombs directly from Russian territory. Previously confirmation of the use of the winged FAB-3000 in Ukraine was published. The numbers in the name of such bombs indicate the total weight of the product.The Russian army began actively using the UMPC in the spring of this year. And the problem with the updated FABs was immediately revealed - often the bombs simply do not reach Ukraine. According to ASTRA estimates, in total, from March to September, Russian planes dropped at least 128 aerial bombs on Russia and the occupied territories of Ukraine. FAB-250 and FAB-500 fall most often. Usually, during an emergency gathering, they do not explode - the bombs are destroyed after the fact by explosives technicians. At the beginning of July, FAB-3000 fell for the first time from a Russian plane in the Belgorod region. A bomb exploded in a field near Shebekino. Since the bomb fell in a field, there were no casualties. May 4 a Russian plane dropped a FAB-500 on Belgorod, as a result of which 7 people were injured, 31 households and 10 cars damaged.
